sentences.en: A meteorite shower would have a bad effect on crops.
sentences.cn: 这个村的农民大多以种植经济作物为生.

sentences.en: A meteorite streaked across the sky.
sentences.cn: 一颗流星划过天空。

sentences.en: Coming through the sky like a satellite, like a radio wave, a meteorite.
sentences.cn: 穿过天空,像一枚卫星, 一束电波, 一颗陨石.

sentences.en: GR 99027 meteorite from Blue Ice Area in Antarctica is an achondrite.
sentences.cn: 来自南极格罗夫山蓝冰地区的GR99027陨石为一无球粒陨石.

sentences.en: He discovered an unusual meteorite.
sentences.cn: 他发现了一块奇异的陨石.

sentences.en: I close the meteorite room and try the door across thecorridor.
sentences.cn: 我关上陨石房间的门，又打开了走廊对面的门。

sentences.en: If the contamination were terrestrial, one could expect equal amounts of the molecules (or less) to be present in the meteorite samples, certainly not more.
sentences.cn: 如果污染是来自地面的，在陨石样品中有可能会发现等量（或者较少）的分子，但肯定不会多。

sentences.en: It must be a meteorite.
sentences.cn: 它肯定是一块陨石.

sentences.en: More power outages reported today caused by last week's meteorite strike.
sentences.cn: 因为上次陨星的坠落,越来越多的停电的报告.

sentences.en: So there are many other probable meteorite craters, but need further more investigations and verification.
sentences.cn: 因而,地图上还有许多疑似陨石坑的地貌构造, 还须进一步调查求证.

sentences.en: Star called wormwood A Meteorite, or by pollution or by both.
sentences.cn: 名叫[茵陈]的星:殒石或污染,或两者皆有.

sentences.en: The extra hole in the Chinese pictures could suggest it was hit by extra meteorite.
sentences.cn: 在中国的图片中这个额外的洞有可能是额外的一次陨星撞击产生的.

sentences.en: The famous Murchison meteorite smashed into the Australian ground in 1969.
sentences.cn: 1969年著名的默奇森陨石轰然坠落在澳大利亚.

sentences.en: The formation was originally thought to be caused by a meteorite impact but now geologists believe it is a product of uplift and erosion.
sentences.cn: 对于形成的原因，一开始认为是陨星的撞击造成的，但现在地质学家认为是地壳隆起和腐蚀的结果。

sentences.en: The group, based at Imperial College London, found some of the base building blocks for life, nucleobases, in dust from the Murchison meteorite which fell to Earth in 1969.
sentences.cn: 研究小组由伦敦帝国学院创建，他们在1969年坠入地球的默奇森陨石尘埃中发现了碱基，这是构建生命的基本成分。

sentences.en: The meteorite might have caused a huge dust cloud.
sentences.cn: 陨星可引起巨大的尘埃云.

sentences.en: The meteorite which devastated Tunguska is now estimated to have been about 50 metres across.
sentences.cn: 据猜测,毁灭通古斯的陨石的直径有近50英里.

sentences.en: To infer, the Guangzhou city belongs to the spread area of probable meteorite craters.
sentences.cn: 据此推测, 广州市区属疑似陨石坑分布区.

sentences.en: Under that argument, academics say the giant reptiles mostly froze or starved to death when a huge cloud of particles kicked up by the meteorite blocked the world's sunlight for months.
sentences.cn: 根据这种观点，学者们认为当陨星扬起的巨大粒子云挡住了阳光，阳光长达数月无法照射到地球上时，这种大型爬行动物大部分被冻死或饿死。

sentences.en: We just had a meteorite hit us in financial markets.
sentences.cn: 我们的金融市场刚刚遭受了一块陨石的撞击.

sentences.en: While flying over the Channel, the pilot saw what he thought to be a meteorite.
sentences.cn: 飞过英吉利海峡时，驾驶员认为他看见了一颗陨星。

words.tran_cn: 流星；[气象] 大气现象

trans.tran_en: A meteorite is a large piece of rock or metal from space that has landed on Earth
